message.content:
The easiest way to prepare zucchini for cooking is by washing, trimming it and then slicing or chopping it into the desired size:

1. Rinse the zucchini under cool running water, gently rubbing off any dirt or debris with your fingers.

2. Lay out a cutting board on a stable surface.

3. Place the clean zucchini on the cutting board.

4. Using a sharp knife, trim off each end of the zucchini – slice off about ¼ inch from both tips to discard stem and bottom tip.

5. Decide if you want to peel your zucchini— you can leave its skin: Many recipes call for leaving the skin on as it contains nutrients; however, some people opt to remove their skins due to texture preference or if they're using large-sized matured ones that come with thicker and tougher skins than smaller tender ones.

   -If you decide to peel yours: Use a vegetable peeler or paring knife to gently remove its outer layer in long thin strips lengthwise; apply even pressure so that only its green exterior comes off without removing too much flesh underneath.

6. Slice/Chop/Dice accordingTo recipe requirements
- For slices: Cut Zucchinis longitudinally (the long way) into halves_ Then place flat sides down & cut crosswise(breadthways); You could switch things up_thickness-wise.
 
-For Chops: Follow steps done when getting slices above_when at cross-cutting stage_ turn recently sliced pieces horizontally & make parallel cuts downwards across initial_slice lines_zigzag/chopping style_moves work best here(forms similarsize dice like appearancel)

7.Optional; Removing seeds(especially recommended for older/bigger overripe ones)
-once halved(cut length
